column1: Linkou District (Chinese: 林口區; pinyin: Línkǒu Qū; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Nâ-kháu khu) is a district in the western part of New Taipei in northern Taiwan.
As of April 2015 it has a population of 98
column2: 524 and the fastest growth rate among all districts in New Taipei City.

column1: The district administers 17 urban villages (all seventeen of which were rural villages (村) before changes made on 25 December 2010):
New Taipei Municipal Lin-kou High School
Linkou is served by the National Highway No. 1
column2: as well as Provincial Highways No. 15 and No. 61. County routes 105
column3: 106 and 108 also run through the district.

column1: Mitsui Outlet Park: The biggest shopping mall in Linkou area. It offers recreational international brands stores
